    The Failed requests in ApacheBench Test

    Problem: I run ab test for my website yesterday, and there are so many failed request. And I found the following explanation from fixunix:

    May not actually be a problem. Reason? It might be a site that serves dynamic context (such as different cookie IDs mentioned) where the file size changes between each query. 

Easy way to verify: 

Code:    $ wget    

Repeat that twice, then: 

Code:    $ diff  .1 

See if there are differences. If yes, then you can ignore the length-related failures. If no, it's some other cause and need to investigate further.

    I hope it will help you too if you have the same problem.

    Pure CSS to make the footer at the bottom of the page

    Pure CSS, no javascript to make the footer at the bottom of the page. Imaging you have the html layout like the following:

    <body>

<div id="container">
<div id="header"></div>
<div id="body"></div>
<div id="footer"></div>

</body>

    What you will do is simple.

    html,
body {
margin:0;
padding:0;
height:100%;
}
#container {
min-height:100%;
position:relative;
}
#footer {
position:absolute;
bottom:0;
width:100%;
height:60px;/* Height of the footer */
background:#6cf;
}

    Thanks to Matthew James Taylor who gives the idea how to implement this.

    June 22, 2009 | View Comments

    Run CakePHP CronJob On Web Hosting

    /usr/local/bin/php /home/Username/www/cake/console/cake.php -app /home/Username/www/app cronjob

    ::Replace Username with your account name in Web Sharing Hosting.

    June 11, 2009 | View Comments

    Fighting with subdomain problem in Lunarpages

    HostROOT -

    |- .htaccess(A)

    |--------------- |-subdirectory

    |--------------- -----------|- .htaccess(B)

    My host domain - http://www.example.com

    My sub domain - http://subdomain.example.com

    Don't forget to add a .htaccess file for your subdirectory and add the following content into it.

    .htaccess(B) <IfModule mod_rewrite.c> RewriteEngine on RewriteBase /subdirectory/ </IfModule>

    It worked as true. When I recall the process I fight with the

    Reference:http://bakery.cakephp.org/articles/view/mod-rewrite-on-godaddy-shared-hosting

    June 06, 2009 | View Comments

    Solution:ERROR 2006 (HY000) at line 140: MySQL server has gone away

    Add a line into your my.ini

    max_allowed_packet = 12M

    Give a bigger size if you need.

    May 26, 2009 | View Comments

    How to use Security component in your application

    The right way is generate all your filed use form helper.

    For example, the following code will prevent your app woking .

    <?php echo $form->create('User', array('action'=>'signup')); ?>
    //....
    </form>
    But if you modify these codes into following,
    <?php echo $form->create('User', array('action'=>'signup')); ?>
    //....
    <?php echo $form->end();?>
    It work again!
